key_channel_insights.line_content: Missing fares grew to 20.6%, and while OTA fares still top the website 64% of the time, this compares to 82% previously.
No missing or higher fares found; 71% matched and 29% were lower than the website.
All fares remain unavailable, with no variation from past weeks.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA N/A occurrences increased from 0.084 to 0.206 over the last week, signaling potentially missing or mismatched fare data in the channel.
While OTA Higher remains the leading status at 64%, it has dropped notably from 82% in the previous week.
Fewer than 2% of itineraries carried a lower fare on the OTA, indicating limited undercutting.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Expanded from 0.084 to 0.206 week-over-week (+12.22%), highlighting an increase in unlisted website fares.
Held steady near 0.145 in the latest week, with minimal single-digit growth from the previous week.
Despite leading at 0.637 this week, it's down by 18% from last weekâ€™s 0.8204, reflecting less channel mark-up activity.
Stands at just 0.013, largely unchanged from previous trends, showing minimal below-website pricing.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Mirrors overall patterns: OTA Higher at 64% but declining vs. recent weeks, while OTA N/A is growing modestly.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Shows identical distribution trends to Short Haul, with a noticeable rise in OTA N/A and a dip in OTA Higher from previous week.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA Higher leads at 66% but slipped 15% from last week; OTA N/A rose to 0.1801, suggesting coverage gaps.
OTA Higher stands at 58%, a drop of nearly 25% from the prior week, while OTA N/A jumped significantly to over 26%.

mse_highlights.line_content: No offers missing or priced higher on MSE in the latest week.
71% matched the website, and 29% were lower last week.
MSE-lower deals dropped from 61% to 29% week over week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No missing website fares on MSE (0% in all observed periods).
71% last week, compared to 39% prior week and 45% last month.
29% last week, down from 61% prior week and 55% last month.
No cases detected across all time frames.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Last week, 71% matched and 29% were lower. No higher-priced listings observed.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Mirror of short-haul results: 71% same, 29% lower last week, none higher.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 75% at parity, 25% lower last week, improving from 45% parity previously.
64% same vs 36% lower last week, rising from 29% same previously.

gds_highlights.line_content: All eight ODs remain listed as GDS N/A, indicating no website fares are loaded in this channel.
No changes in availability compared to previous week or month; this gap persists across all comparison periods.
The consistent absence of fares on GDS may point to policy or technical constraints restricting content.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: All records (100%) remain in the not-found category, showing no week-over-week or month-over-month shift.
No scenarios where GDS and website prices match.
No instances of cheaper GDS fares registered.
No occurrences of higher GDS fares identified.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: All flights remain GDS N/A with no changes from prior weeks or months.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: All eight Greek ODs are GDS N/A, reflecting the same pattern seen in previous periods.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: All 211 itineraries remain GDS N/A, with zero shift across three periods.
All 99 itineraries remain GDS N/A, unchanged compared to earlier weeks and months.
